column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C  and line a muffin tin with 12 cupcake cases.', 'Cream together the butter and sugar until pale and fluffy then add the eggs one by one mixing after each one.', 'Sift the flour and carefully fold into the mixture.', 'Then stir in the vanilla extract.', 'Spoon the mixture into the paper cases until they are approximately full.', 'Then bake in the oven for 25 30 minutes until golden brown and a skewer comes out clean.', 'Leave to cool.', 'To decorate roll out some of the white icing until it is about 4 5mm thick then cut a disc about the same size as the top of the cupcake.', 'Brush the top of the cake with some warmed apricot jam then position the icing on top.', 'Next roll out some of the red icing and using a flower cutter cut out some flowers.', 'Place the flower onto a folded tea towel and use your fingers to carefully thin out the petals so that they start to curl.', 'Place these on the top of the cupcake using water to glue it to the white icing.', 'To finish take small pieces of black icing and roll into a ball then squash it slightly.', 'Attach this to the centre of each poppy flower again using some water.']

column3: [{'main': ['150g Butter ', '150g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar', '3 Egg ', '125g Self raising white flour', '25g Cocoa powder']}, {'frosting': ['50g Butter ', '175g Icing sugar', ' Green food colouring']}, {'topping': [' Sweets ']}]
column4: ['Heat the oven to 180 C .', 'Line a cup cake tray with 12 paper cupcake cases.', 'Place the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl and beat with a wooden spoon or electric mixer until light and fluffy.', 'Gradually beat in the eggs a little at a time until smooth adding a little flour if the mixture curdles.', 'Stir in the flour and cocoa powder until smooth.', 'Place heaped dessertspoon full in each cupcake case and bake for 20 25 minutes until golden brown and just firm to the touch.', 'Allow the cupcakes to cool completely.', 'To make the buttercream Mix the butter and icing sugar together until light and fluffy then add a drop of food colouring to colour the icing green.', 'Using a piping bag and grass nozzle pipe the icing on top of each cupcake.', 'Decorate with edible football decorations.']

column3: [{'main': ['150g Butter ', '150g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar', '3 Egg ', '150g Self raising white flour', '100g Raspberries ', '0.5 tsp Mint leaves ']}, {'frosting': ['25g Butter ', '75g Cream cheese', '1 tbsp Raspberry jam', '400g Icing sugar']}]
column4: ['Pre heat the oven to 180 c .', 'Line a 12 hole cupcake pan with paper cases.', 'Cream together the softened butter and golden caster sugar on a medium speed until light and fluffy.', 'Add the eggs one by one following each with a spoonful of the flour.', 'Mix until evenly combined.', 'Add the flour to the bowl and mix until fully incorporated.', 'Add the raspberries and chopped mint and mix again until evenly dispersed.', 'Fill each paper case with cupcake mixture filling each 2/3rds full.', 'Bake in the oven for 20 25 minutes until well risen and golden.', 'Transfer to a wire rack and allow to cool.', 'To prepare the buttercream beat the butter then add the cream cheese and jam beat again until fully combined.', 'Sift in the icing sugar and mix until fully incorporated.', 'Fit a large piping bag with a star nozzle and add the frosting to the bag.', 'Pipe swirls of frosting to the top of each cupcake and add a raspberry to each to decorate.']

column3: [{'main': ['110g Butter ', '110g Caster sugar', '2 Eggs', '110g Self Raising Flour', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', '1 tbsp Milk']}, {'frosting': ['140g Butter ', '280g Icing sugar', '1 tbsp Milk', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract']}, {'storm_trooper': ['12 White marshmallows', '1 Black icing pen']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 c/350 f/Gas 4 and line a 12 hole muffin tin with paper cases.', 'Cream the butter and sugar together in a bowl until pale.', 'Beat in the eggs a little at a time and stir in the vanilla extract.', 'Fold in the flour at the same time adding a little milk until the mixture is of a dropping consistency.', 'Spoon the mixture into the paper cases until they are half full.', 'Bake in the oven for 10 15 minutes or until golden brown on top and a skewer inserted into one of the cakes comes out clean.', 'Set aside to cool.', 'For the buttercream icing beat the butter in a large bowl until soft.', 'Add half the icing sugar and beat until smooth.', 'Then add the remaining icing sugar with one tablespoon of the milk until the mixture is smooth and creamy.', 'Spoon the icing into a piping bag with a star nozzle and pipe the icing using a spiralling motion onto the cup cakes in a large swirl.', 'Add a marshmallow to the top and paint on a Stormtrooper face using an edible icing pen.']

column3: [{'main': ['200g Unsalted butter', '200g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '3 Free range medium eggs', '150g Allinson s Self Raising White Flour', '50g Cocoa powder', '1 tsp Nielsen massey chocolate extract']}, {'topping': ['400g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '200g Unsalted butter', '96 Liquorice sweets ', '12 Oreo cookies', '12 Mini marshmallows']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C  and line a cupcake tin with 12 cupcake cases.', 'We used black for the spiders body Cream together the butter and sugar until pale and fluffy then add the eggs one by one beating well between each one.', 'Then add the chocolate extract.', 'Next carefully fold in the flour and sieved cocoa powder then spoon into the cupcake cases until they are about 2/3 full.', 'Place in the oven for about 20 minutes or until a skewer inserted in the centre comes out clean.', 'Remove from the oven and leave to cool.', 'To make the buttercream beat together the butter and icing sugar until light and fluffy.', 'Spoon this onto the top of the cooled cakes using the back of the spoon to smooth the buttercream into a dome.', 'Take the liquorice strands and cut them down for the legs then carefully place 4 legs on each side of the cupcake.', 'Place the Oreo cookie on top for the body of the spider and then halve a mini marshmallow for the eyes and add a tiny piece of liquorice for the centre of the eyes.']

column3: [{'main': ['150g Unsalted butter', '150g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '3 Medium eggs', '150g Allinson s Self Raising White Flour', '0.5 tsp Baking powder', '1 tsp Mixed spice', '1 tbsp Silver spoon black treacle', '100g Raisins']}, {'topping': ['1 tbsp Apricot jam ', '150g Marzipan', '150g Yellow sugar paste icing']}]
column4: ['Heat the oven to 180 C .', 'Line a cup cake tin with 12 paper cupcake cases.', 'Place the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl and beat with a wooden spoon or electric mixer until light and fluffy.', 'Gradually beat in the eggs a little at a time until smooth adding a little flour if the mixture curdles.', 'Stir in the flour baking powder mixed spice treacle and raisins and stir well until evenly mixed.', 'Place a heaped dessertspoon in each cupcake case and bake for 20 25 minutes until golden brown and just firm to the touch.', 'Allow to cool on a wire rack.', 'Brush the top of the cakes with a little jam.', 'Roll out the marzipan thinly and using a fluted biscuit cutter cut out 12 small circles of marzipan.', 'Place on top of the cakes.', 'Lightly brown the marzipan under the grill or using a blowtorch.', 'To make the daffodils roll out the yellow sugar paste icing and using a flower cutter cut out flower shapes.', 'Roll a small ball of yellow sugar paste and using a cocktail stick or skewer poke a hole in the centre rotating the stick around slightly to make the hole bigger.', 'This will form the centre of your daffodil.', 'Lightly brush the centre of the flower shape with water and gently secure the flower centre to it.', 'Place on top of each cupcake.']

column3: [{'main': ['150g Butter ', '150g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar', '3 Egg ', '125g Self raising white flour', '25g Cocoa powder', '1 tsp Chocolate extract']}, {'frosting': ['220g Silver Spoon White caster sugar', '2 Egg white ', '80ml Water', ' Sprinkle decorations']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C  and line a cupcake tin with 12 cupcake cases.', 'In a large bowl cream together the butter and sugar until they are pale and fluffy.', 'Add the eggs one at a time beating well in between each one.', 'Then add the chocolate extract.', 'Carefully fold in the sieved flour and cocoa powder mixing until it is evenly combined.', 'Then spoon into the cupcake cases until they are about 2/3 full.', 'Place in the oven and bake for about 20 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean.', 'Remove from the oven and leave to cool.', 'To make the marshmallow frosting place the sugar and water in a medium saucepan and gently heat until the sugar has dissolved.', 'Don t stir.', 'Bring this to the boil and simmer until it reaches 116 C on your sugar thermometer.', 'This will take about 10 15 minutes.', 'Remove from the heat and let the bubbles subside.', 'Whisk the egg whites until they reach the soft peak stage then still whisking pour in the sugar syrup.', 'Then continue to whisk for about 10 minutes until it is thick and cool.', 'Pipe the frosting onto the cooled cupcakes.', 'Decorate with sprinkle star decorations.']

column3: [{'main': ['175g Unsalted butter ', '175g Self Raising Flour', '175g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '1/2 tsp Baking powder', '1/2 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', '3 Large free range egg ']}, {'frosting': ['175g Unsalted butter ', '1 tsp Cherry extract', '3 tbsp Milk', '350g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '2 drops Pink food colouring gel', '12 Love bird / roses decorations']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C  and line a 12 hole muffin/cupcake tin with your chosen cupcake cases.', 'Place all the cupcake ingredients into a large mixing bowl or food mixer and beat together until light fluffy and pale in colour.', 'Using a spoon spoon the mixture into the cupcake cases filling each one 2/3 full.', 'Bake the cupcakes in the oven for 20 25 minutes until golden springy to touch and baked throughout.', 'Once the cupcakes are baked leave to cool on a wire cooling rack whilst you make up the buttercream.', 'To make the buttercream beat the butter in a mixer until light and fluffy then gradually add in the icing sugar and cherry flavouring.', 'Add the milk gradually if needed to loosen up the buttercream.', 'It is best to beat the buttercream for as long as you can as the longer that you beat it for the lighter and fluffier it will be.', 'Divide the mixture in two seperating into two separate bowls.', 'Using a few drops of pink food colouring gel into one of the bowls of buttercream beat the buttercream until it reaches the desired pink colour.', 'Open up a piping bag fitted with a star nozzle and spread the pink buttercream down one side of the inside of the bag and the white buttercream down the other side.', 'Alternatively you could use a duo colour piping bag to create the same effect.', 'Pipe the buttercream on to the cupcakes in a circular motion and this should create the double colour effect.', 'Finish with the lovebird or rose cake decorations.']

column3: [{'main': ['150g Butter ', '150g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '3 Egg ', '150g Self raising white flour', '1/2 tsp Baking powder', '1/2 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract']}, {'frosting': ['250g Icing sugar', '80g Butter ', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', 'A few drops Yellow food colouring']}, {'rose': ['100g Red sugar paste icing']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C .', 'Line a cupcake tin with 12 paper cupcake cases.', 'Beat together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.', 'Gradually add in the eggs baking powder flour and vanilla extract and beat until fully combined.', 'Spoon the mixture into the cupcake cases filling each of them 2/3 full.', 'Bake for 20 25 minutes until the cupcakes are golden and springy to touch.', 'Whilst the cupcakes are baking make the buttercream by beating together the butter icing sugar food colouring and vanilla extract.', 'Fill a piping bag with the buttercream and pipe swirls on top of the cupcakes.', 'To finish create a rose from the red sugar paste icing.']

column3: [{'main': ['4 tbsp Boiling water', '40g Cocoa powder', '3 Eggs ', '175g Butter ', '165g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '115g Self Raising Flour', '1 tsp Baking powder']}, {'frosting': ['175g Butter ', '350g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '2 tbsp Milk', '100g Oreos', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract']}, {'topping': ['14 Oreos']}]
column4: ['Begin by preparing a 12 hole cupcake tin with cupcake cases and preheating your oven to 200 C  In a large bowl beat together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.', 'Add the eggs one by one mixing in a tablespoon of the flour with each egg to avoid the mixture from curdling.', 'In a separate bowl mix together the cocoa powder and boiling water to make a smooth paste.', 'Add the flour and baking powder to the egg mixture followed by the cocoa paste and blend all the ingredients together until you reach a smooth batter.', 'Spoon the mixture into each of the cupcake cases filling each 2/3 full.', 'Bake in the oven for 12 15 minutes until springy to touch.', 'Remove the cupcakes from the oven and allow to cool on a wire cooling rack.', 'Whilst the cupcakes are cooling make your buttercream by beating together the butter milk vanilla extract and half of the icing sugar.', 'Once these ingredients are combined add the remaining icing sugar and Oreos chopped finely and beat until light and fluffy.', 'The longer that you beat the icing for the lighter it will be.', 'To finish your cupcakes fill another piping bag with a star nozzle and your Oreo buttercream and pipe swirls on to the top of each cupcake.', 'For an extra touch add an Oreo to the top of the buttercream.']

column3: [{'main': ['150g Butter ', '150g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '3 Eggs ', '150g Self raising white flour', '1/2 tsp Baking powder', '1/2 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract']}, {'frosting': ['175g Butter ', '350g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '200g Lotus biscoff caramelised biscuit spread smooth', '2 tbsp Milk ']}, {'topping': ['10 Lotus biscuit']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C .', 'Line a cupcake tin with 12 paper cupcake cases.', 'Beat together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.', 'Gradually add in the eggs baking powder flour and vanilla extract and beat until fully combined.', 'Spoon the mixture into the cupcake cases filling each of them 2/3 full.', 'Bake for 20 25 minutes until the cupcakes are golden and springy to touch.', 'Whilst the cupcakes are baking make the buttercream by beating together the butter icing sugar milk and Biscoff spread.', 'The longer that you beat the buttercream the lighter and fluffier it becomes.', 'When the cupcakes have cooled fully use a small sharp knife or an apple corer to carve out the centre of the sponge of each cupcake.', 'Fill a piping bag with a large star nozzle and the Biscoff buttercream.', 'Pipe a small amount into the centre of each cake then top with the remaining sponge that you had removed.', 'To finish your cupcakes pipe swirls of the buttercream on to the top of each cupcake.', 'For an extra touch add a Lotus biscuit on top of the buttercream.']

column3: [{'main': ['150g Butter ', '150g Billington s Unrefined Light Muscovado Sugar', '3 Egg ', '150g Self raising white flour', '0.5 tsp Baking powder', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract']}, {'toffee_cream': ['60g Butter ', '250g Unrefined golden icing sugar']}, {'sauce': ['3 tbsp Dulce de leche']}]
column4: ['Heat the oven to 180 C .', 'Line a cup cake tin with 12 paper cupcake cases.', 'Place the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl and beat with a wooden spoon or electric mixer until light and fluffy.', 'Gradually beat in the eggs a little at a time until smooth adding a little flour if the mixture curdles.', 'Stir in the flour baking powder and vanilla extract until smooth.', 'Place heaped dessertspoon full in each cupcake case and bake for 20 25 minutes until golden brown and just firm to the touch.', 'To make the icing place the butter and icing sugar into a mixing bowl and beat until smooth and creamy.', 'Pipe onto the cupcakes and drizzle or pipe with the dulce de leche or caramel evaporated milk.']

column3: [{'main': ['225g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar', '225g Butter ', '4 Egg ', '225g Self raising white flour', '0.5 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract']}, {'topping': [' White sugar paste icing', ' Green sugar paste icing', ' Red sugar paste icing', ' Black sugar paste icing', ' Brown/chocolate sugar paste icing', ' Silver balls']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 160 C .', 'Line a cupcake tin with cupcake cases.', 'Cream together the butter and sugar until pale fluffy add the vanilla extract and eggs one at a time beating until mixed.', 'Gently fold in the flour.', 'Spoon the mixture into the cases until 2/3 full.', 'Bake in the oven for 25 minutes until golden brown or a skewer comes out clean.', 'Allow to cool on a wire rack.', 'To make the snowman roll out white icing and cut a disc the same size as the cake and stick onto the cake using some warmed jam.', 'Roll out some red icing and cut into a semi circle place this on the cake for the snowman s hat use a ball of white icing for the bobble and a strip of white for the brim of the hat.', 'Use small balls of black icing for his eyes and a small cone of red for his nose.', 'Give him a smile using the knife.', 'To make a snowflake cover the cake with a disc of red icing then using a knife or snowflake cutter cut a snowflake shape and stick to the top using water.', 'To make a tree use a sharp knife to cut a Christmas tree shape in the green sugar paste icing and place on the cake using water to stick decorate the tree with silver balls.', 'For Santa mix together some white and red icing to make a pink face then roll out some white icing and cut out shapes for his beard and hat then use a red semi circle for his hat stick to the face using water then use balls of black for his eyes red for his nose and white for the bobble on his hat.']

column3: [{'main': ['150g Self raising white flour', '1 tsp Baking powder', '125g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar', '125g Butter ', '2 Egg ', '3 Banana ', '50g Fudge pieces']}, {'frosting': ['60g Dulce de leche', '150g Unrefined golden icing sugar', '75g Butter ', ' Banana chips']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C .', 'Sit 12 paper cases into a muffin tin.', 'Break the eggs into a bowl and add the sugar.', 'Whisk using an electric whisk for at least 4 minutes.', 'This mixture should be light and fluffy.', 'Sieve together the flour and baking powder.', 'While still whisking add the flour and butter a little at a time whisking the mixture each time to ensure a smooth texture.', 'Fold in the mashed banana and fudge pieces.', 'Spoon the mixture evenly into the cupcake cases to about 2/3 full.', 'Smooth the surface slightly.', 'Bake in the oven for 15 20 minutes until they feel spongy and golden brown.', 'Remove the cakes from the tin and leave to cool on a wire rack.', 'Beat the butter until soft and smooth and add the icing sugar a little at a time until you get a smooth mix.', 'Fold in a tablespoon of the dulce de leche.', 'Top the cakes with the butter icing and the remaining dulce de leche.', 'Decorate with banana chips']

column3: [{'main': ['150g Butter ', '150g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar', '3 Egg ', '150g Self raising white flour', '0.5 tsp Baking powder', '2 Lavender heads']}, {'topping': ['200g Fondant icing sugar', ' Purple food colouring', '12g Lavender heads']}]
column4: ['Heat the oven to 180 C .', 'Line a cup cake tin with 12 paper cupcake cases.', 'Place the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl and beat with a wooden spoon or electric mixer until light and fluffy.', 'Gradually beat in the eggs a little at a time until smooth adding a little flour if the mixture curdles.', 'Pull the seeds off the lavender heads and add to the mixture to give the desired flavour.', 'Stir in the flour and baking powder until evenly mixed.', 'Place heaped dessertspoon full in each cupcake case and bake for 20 25 minutes until golden brown and just firm to the touch.', 'Allow to cool on a wire rack.', 'To decorate make up the fondant icing as directed on the packet to make a very thick pourable icing.', 'Add a drop of colouring to achieve a beautiful lilac colour.', 'Pour over the cupcakes and leave to set then top with lavender heads.']
column22: [{'main': ['190g Allinson s Plain White Flour', '190g Allinson s Self Raising White Flour', '1 tbsp Baking powder', '1 tsp Salt', '227g Unsalted butter ', '350g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '4 Large free range eggs', '2 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', '310ml Whole milk', '2 tsp Ground cinnamon']}, {'topping': ['4 tbsp Unsalted butter', '85g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '1 tsp Ground cinnamon']}, {'topping': ['115g Unsalted butter', '227g Cream cheese', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', '1 tsp Ground cinnamon', '550g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar']}]
column23: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C and line a muffin or cupcake tray with your cupcake cases.', 'Whisk together the plain and self raising flours baking powder salt and cinnamon until combined.', 'In a separate bowl with an electric whisk or in a stand mixer cream the butter and sugar on a medium/high speed until creamy and fluffy.', 'Add the eggs to the sugar and butter mixture one at a time.', 'Beat each until fully incorporated into the mixture.', 'Add the vanilla and then reduce the speed to low.', 'Add in the flour mixture a bit at a time alternating with the addition of the milk.', 'Ensure the mixture is combined after each flour and milk addition before adding th next.', 'Fill the cupcake cases until they are full and bake for 20 minutes until golden.', 'Once the cupcakes are baked transfer them to a wire cooling rack to cool completely.', 'When they have cooled completely melt the butter in a saucepan.', 'While the butter is melting put the sugar and cinnamon in a bowl or on plate and ensure they are completely mixed.', 'Using a pastry brush brush the top of each cupcake with the melted butter.', 'Don t use too much as you don t want the cupcakes to go soggy.', 'Once they have been topped with melted butter dip them in the sugar and cinnamon mixture to add a crunchy topping.', 'To make the cinnamon cream cheese topping beat together the butter and cream cheese until light and fluffy.', 'Add in the vanilla cinnamon and icing sugar until it is fully incorporated.', 'Using a piping bag and star nozzle pipe the buttercream onto the top of the cupcakes.']

column3: [{'main': ['4 tbsp Boiling water', '40g Cocoa powder', '3 Free range large eggs', '175g Unsalted butter', '165g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '115g Allinson s Self Raising White Flour', '1 tsp Baking powder']}, {'frosting': ['300g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '100g Unsalted butter', '40g Cocoa powder', '40ml Whole milk']}, {'topping': ['12 Askeys fan wafer', '30g Orange sugar paste icing', '30g White sugar paste icing', '1 Writing icing pen']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven at 200 C  and line 12 muffin tins.', 'Sift the cocoa powder into a bowl and mix with the boiling water to create a thick paste.', 'Add the remaining cake ingredients and beat together.', 'Divide the mixture evenly between the cases filling them 2/3 full.This video shows you how to make sure your cupcakes are even.', 'Bake in a pre heated oven for 20 minutes until well risen and cooked throughout.', 'Leave the cupcakes to cool on a wire rack.', 'To make the buttercream beat the butter until softened and add the icing sugar and cocoa powder.', 'Gradually add the milk to loosen the buttercream to a piping consistency.', 'Fill a piping bag and carefully pipe the buttercream on to each cupcake.', 'To make the turkeys head roll a ball of chocolate sugarpaste.', 'Make the eyes using small balls of white sugarpaste with black centres.', 'The beak is made using orange sugar paste.', 'For the tailfeathers use an ice cream fan wafer and insert the bottom point into the cupcake sponge to hold in place.', 'Using writing icing to make coloured dots on the fan wafer.']

column3: [{'main': ['4 Star anise', '200ml Milk ', '115g Butter ', '150g Silver Spoon White Caster Sugar', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', '170g Self raising white flour', '0.5 tsp Baking powder', '50g Liquorice ', '3 Egg ']}, {'topping': ['100g Black sugar paste icing', '2 tbsp Apricot Jam', ' Liquorice sweets']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C  and line a 12 hole muffin tin with cupcake cases.', 'Pour the milk into a small saucepan and add the star anise heat the milk until it s just about boiling stirring occasionally then remove from the heat before it boils.', 'Leave to one side for the flavours to infuse for 30 minutes or longer.', 'Cream the butter and sugar together until pale and fluffy then add the eggs on by one beating after each addition.', 'Then add the vanilla extract.', 'Sieve in the flour and baking powder and then add the milk having removed the star anise.', 'Fold the mix together until combined.', 'Then add the liquorice and stir in until evenly distributed.', 'Spoon the mixture into the cupcake cases and bake for approximately 25 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean.', 'The leave to cool on a wire rack.', 'Roll out the black sugar paste on a surface lightly dusted with icing sugar to a thickness of a 1 coin.', 'Using a pastry cutter about the same size as the top of the cupcake cut out circles of sugar paste.', 'Lightly brush the surface of the cakes with the warmed apricot jam then place the sugar paste discs on top.', 'Decorate with the liquorice sweets.']

column3: [{'main': ['150g Butter ', '150g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar', '3 Egg ', '150g Self raising white flour', '0.5 tsp Baking powder', '1 Lemon zest ', '0.5 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract']}, {'frosting': ['250g Icing sugar', '80g Butter ', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', ' Pink food colouring']}]
column4: ['Heat the oven to 180 C .', 'Line a cup cake tin with 12 paper cupcake cases Place the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl and beat with a wooden spoon or electric mixer until light and fluffy.', 'Gradually beat in the eggs a little at a time until smooth adding a little flour if the mixture curdles.', 'Stir in the flour baking powder lemon zest and vanilla extract until smooth.', 'Place heaped dessertspoon full in each cupcake case and bake for 20 25 minutes until golden brown and just firm to the touch.', 'Leave in the tins for 5 minutes then place on a wire rack to cool.', 'For the buttercream beat together the butter icing sugar vanilla extract and food colouring and then pipe on to the cupcake.', 'Top with a special birthday candle.']

column3: [{'main': ['200g Unsalted butter ', '100g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '100g Billington s Unrefined Light Muscovado Sugar', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Coffee Extract', '4 Medium free range eggs ', '200g Self raising white flour', '2 tbsp Strong coffee']}, {'syrup': ['50g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '4 tbsp Strong coffee', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Coffee Extract']}, {'frosting': ['200g Cream cheese', '100g Unsalted butter ', '600g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Coffee Extract', '1 tbsp Strong coffee']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C .', 'Line two cupcake trays with cupcake cases.', 'Using either an electric mixer or mixing bowl and whisk beat the butter and sugars together until pale and fluffy then whisk in the coffee extract and coffee.', 'Reduce the whisk speed and slowly add the eggs along with a tbsp of the flour to prevent it from curdling.', 'Add the remaining flour and then using either a piping bag or ice cream scoop divide the batter between the cupcake cases and place in the oven for 20 minutes or until lightly golden and firm to the touch.', 'Leave the cakes to cool a little on a wire rack.', 'To make the syrup place the golden caster sugar in a pan with the strong coffee.', 'Simmer for a few minutes until dissolved then take off the heat and set aside to cool.', 'Once cool stir in 1tsp of coffee extract.', 'Add some sugar syrup to the top of each cupcake.', 'To ice put the cream cheese butter coffee extract coffee and golden icing sugar in a mixing bowl and slowly mix together until light and fluffy.', 'Place in a piping bag and ice accordingly.']

column3: [{'main': ['150g Butter ', '150g Silver Spoon Caster Sugar', '150g Allinson s Self Raising Flour', '3 Eggs ', '1 tsp Baking powder', '2 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract']}, {'frosting': ['115g Unsalted butter', '125g Icing sugar', '1 tbsp Milk', '1 tbsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Bean Paste']}, {'middle': ['2 tbsp Raspberry jam']}]
column4: ['First make the cake.', 'Preheat the oven to 190 c/170 c fan/Gas 5.', 'Grease and line a square 20cm/8 inch tin.', 'Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and then bake for 25 minutes.', 'To test if it s baked insert a skewer to the middle if it comes out clean it means it s ready.', 'If not just keep baking until it is.', 'When the cake is cooked allow it to cool completely on a wire rack.', 'To make your buttercream mix together in a clean dry bowl the icing sugar.', 'butter milk and vanilla bean paste.', 'When you are ready to make the cupcake jars.', 'Cut circles from your cooled cake with the cutter and then divide into quarters.', 'They will easily fit through the neck of the jar to be reassembled within.', 'Once the cake layer is in the jar add a table spoon of jam and then pipe the buttercream on top of that.', 'Top with another layer of cake then jam and then buttercream.', 'Finally add the lid of the jar and tie a ribbon around the jar neck.']

column3: [{'main': ['20g Strawberries ', '150g Butter ', '150g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '3 Egg ', '150g Self raising white flour', '0.5 tsp Baking powder']}, {'frosting': ['400g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '100g Butter ', ' Pink food colouring', ' Strawberries ']}]
column4: ['Heat the oven to 180 C .', 'Line a cupcake tin with 12 paper cupcake cases.', 'Crush the strawberries in a pestle and mortar until finely ground but not completely powdered.', 'Cream the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl until smooth light and creamy.', 'Gradually beat in the eggs until the mixture is smooth.', 'Add 15g of the strawberries and all of the flour.', 'Divide the mixture into the cupcake cases and bake for 20 25 minutes until golden and just firm to the touch.', 'To make the icing place the remaining strawberries in a mixing bowl with the icing sugar softened butter and a small drop of pink food colouring.', 'Mix with a little hot water if needed to make a smooth icing.', 'Pipe a swirl of icing on top of each cake and top with a strawberry.']

column3: [{'main': ['150g Unsalted butter', '150g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '3 Large free range egg ', '125g Self raising white flour', '25g Cocoa powder']}, {'frosting': ['50g Unsalted butter', '175g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', 'A few drops Green food colouring gel']}, {'topping': ['6 tsp Billington s Unrefined Light Muscovado Sugar', '100g White sugar paste icing']}]
column4: ['Heat the oven to 180 C .', 'Line a cup cake tray with 12 paper cupcake cases.', 'Place the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl and beat with a wooden spoon or electric mixer until light and fluffy.', 'Gradually beat in the eggs a little at a time until smooth adding a little flour if the mixture curdles.', 'Stir in the flour and cocoa powder until smooth.', 'Place heaped dessert spoon full in each cupcake case and bake for 20 25 minutes until golden brown and just firm to the touch.', 'Allow the cupcakes to cool completely.', 'To make the buttercream mix the butter and icing sugar together until light and fluffy.', 'Keep aside a small amount of the buttercream in a seperate bowl then add a drop of food colouring to the remaining buttercream to colour it green.', 'Spread the green buttercream on top of each cupcake.', 'With the remaining white buttercream spread a small amount on top of the green icing for the bunker and then sprinkle lightly with the light muscovado sugar for sand.', 'Roll small balls of sugar paste icing then using a cocktail stick make the dimples over the balls and place on the cake.', 'Decorate with cocktails stick and paper flags.']

column3: [{'main': ['200g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '200g Unsalted butter ', '3 Medium free range egg ', '200g Self raising white flour', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract']}, {'topping': ['100g White sugar paste icing', '2 tbsp Apricot Jam', '100g Red sugar paste icing', '100g Orange sugar paste icing', '100g Black sugar paste icing', '100g Brown sugar paste icing']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C  and line a 12 hole cupcake tin with cases.', 'Cream together the butter and sugar until pale and fluffy then add the eggs one by one mixing well in between followed by the vanilla extract.', 'Fold in the flour then spoon into the cases until they are about 2/3 full Place in the oven for 20 25 minutes or until golden and a skewer comes out clean.', 'Remove from the oven and leave to cool completely.', 'To make the robin cake topper roll out 2 balls of the brown icing one smaller than the other for the robin body and head.', 'Then roll out a small amount of brown icing to approximately 5mm thickness and cut 2 triangle shapes for the wings.', 'Roll out some red icing for the red breast and cut into a semi circle.', 'Mould some more of the red icing into a cone shape for his hat and push over the top to droop the hat.', 'Roll out a small amount of the orange icing and cut into a diamond for the beak fold this over and gently curl the tips open.', 'Brush the sides of the larger brown ball with cooled boiled water and attach the wings to the body curl the tips of the wings out.', 'Next brush the top of the larger ball with a small amount of cooled boiled water and press the head onto the body so that the body becomes a bit squashed.', 'Attach the red breast with some more water.', 'Next use a small amount of water to attach the red hat to the robin head.', 'Then roll out 2 small balls of white icing and 2 smaller balls of black icing.', 'Attach the black balls to the white to make the eyes then glue these to the head.', 'Next attach the beak to the head.', 'To finish roll out a little of the white icing and cut into a strip for the edge of the hat then attach and finally attach a ball of white icing to the top of the hat.', 'To decorate your cupcakes with the flat robin roll out some brown icing and cut into a disc the same size as the top of the cupcake place this on the cake using some warmed apricot jam to stick.', 'Then cut 2 wing shapes and set to one side.', 'Next roll out some orange icing and cut a diamond for the beak and 2 triangle shapes for the feet.', 'Stick the feet onto the cake using a little boiled water.', 'Next roll out some red icing for the redbreast and cut into shape place this on the cake covering the tops of the feet next attach the beak to the top of the redbreast again using water to glue.', 'Next attach the wings using water and finally add the eyes using small balls of white and black icing.']

column3: [{'main': ['120ml Buttermilk', '0.5 tsp Dark rum', '210g Allinson s Plain White Flour', '110g Butter ', '150g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar', '2 Egg ', '0.5 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', '1 tsp Baking powder', '1 Salt ']}, {'syrup': ['100g Unrefined demerara sugar', '1 tbsp Water', '2 tbsp Dark rum', ' Mint leaves ', '2 Lime zest']}, {'frosting': ['50g Butter ', '200g Icing sugar', ' Mint leaves ', '0.5 tsp Dark rum', ' Lime ']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C .', 'Line a mini muffin tin with paper cases.', 'In a small bowl mix together the buttermilk rum and vanilla extract.', 'In another bowl mix together the flour baking powder and salt.', 'In the bowl of a stand mixer mix the butter and sugar on high speed until creamy.', 'Reduce speed and add eggs one at a time scraping the sides of the bowl after each addition.', 'Add 1/3 of the flour mixture  then 1/2 the buttermilk mixture.', 'Add another 1/3 of the flour then the remaining buttermilk and finally the remaining flour.', 'Scrape the edges of the bowl to ensure all of the flour has been incorporated.', 'Pour the mixture into the prepared tin filling the cases halfway and bake for 20 mins in a preheated oven.', 'Meanwhile prepare the syrup.', 'In a small saucepan bring the water and sugar to the boil.', 'Once the sugar dissolves remove from heat and add rum.', 'Then add the zest of lime and mint.', 'Let this steep for 5 minutes then pass the syrup through a sieve into a bowl discarding what is left over.', 'Once the cupcakes are cool use a skewer to make a hole in the centre of each cupcake.', 'Get a piping bag with a small round nozzle and poke the end of the nozzle into the hole you ve made in the first cupcake and pour some of the syrup into the bag filling the cupcake.', 'Alternatively poke holes in the cupcakes with a skewer and drizzle the syrup into the holes with a spoon.', 'To make the icing beat the butter at high speed in an electric mixer until creamy.', 'Reduce speed and add the icing sugar gradually.', 'Beat for 1 minute until well incorporated.', 'Beat for another 2 minutes at high speed.', 'Scrape the edges of the bowl add the rum and chopped mint.', 'Beat one last time at medium speed.', 'Once cupcakes are fully cooled ice with the buttercream icing.', 'Decorate with slices of lime and mint leaves.']

column3: [{'main': ['250g Unsalted butter ', '250g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '250g Self raising white flour', '1 tsp Baking powder', '4 Large free range egg ', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract']}, {'topping': ['150g White sugar paste icing', 'A few drops Black food colouring gel', '1 tube Black designer icing', '1 tube White designer icing', '1 tube Green designer icing', '1 tube Red designer icing', 'A handful Black jelly beans']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 170 C .', 'Line a muffin tray with 18 cupcake paper cases.', 'Place the butter golden caster sugar flour baking powder vanilla extract and eggs into a mixing bowl.', 'Beat together with an electric mixer until the mixture is pale and fluffy.', 'Spoon the mixture into the cupcake paper cases.', 'Bake for 20 minutes until golden brown.', 'Remove from the oven and allow to cool before decorating.', 'To make a boo cupcake take a walnut size piece of white sugar paste icing.', 'Add a few drops of black food colour and knead it through until you get a marbled grey effect.', 'Boil alittle apricot jam and brush over the top of the cake.', 'Flatten the icing to the size of the cake and lay onto the cupcake.', 'Use ready made chocolate or icing letters to spell BOO To make a spiders web top the cupcake with black designer icing and smooth over the cake using the back of a spoon.', 'Start at the centre of the cake and using white writing icing to draw circles around the cake.', 'Then use a cocktail stick to drag the centre icing to the edge of the cake.', 'Repeat all around the cake until the web design is complete.', 'To make a monster top the cupcake with green designer icing and smooth over the cake using the back of a spoon.', 'Take two black jelly drops cut off the tops and place as eyes.Using red writing icing make a bloody mouth.', 'Take a small piece of white sugar paste icing and colour black using black food colouring flatten and cut into hair.']

column3: [{'main': ['150g Butter ', '150g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar', '3 Egg ', '100g Self raising white flour', '25g Cocoa powder']}, {'frosting': ['50g Butter ', '175g Icing sugar', '1 tsp Green food colouring']}, {'topping': ['100g Brown/chocolate sugar paste icing', '50g White sugar paste icing', ' Designer icing ']}]
column4: ['Heat the oven to 180 C .', 'Line a cup cake tray with 12 paper cupcake cases.', 'Place the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl and beat with a wooden spoon or electric mixer until light and fluffy.', 'Gradually beat in the eggs a little at a time until smooth adding a little flour if the mixture curdles.', 'Stir in the flour and cocoa powder until smooth.', 'Place a heaped dessert spoon in each cupcake case and bake for 20 25 minutes until golden brown and just firm to the touch.', 'Allow the cupcakes to cool completely.', 'To make the butter cream Mix the butter and icing sugar together until light and fluffy adding a drop of boiling water if necessary to loosen the mixture.', 'Add a drop of green food colouring into the buttercream and mix well until you get an even colour.', 'Spread the buttercream onto the cooled cupcakes.', 'Roll a little chocolate or brown coloured sugar paste into small oval shapes and place on top of the cupcakes.', 'Roll thin strips of white ready to roll icing and arrange over the rugby balls then pipe the stitching with white designer icing.']

column3: [{'main': ['115g Unsalted butter ', '115g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '2 Large free range egg ', '115g Self raising white flour', 'A pinch Salt', '2 tbsp Whole milk', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract']}, {'frosting': ['250g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '80g Unsalted butter ', '25ml Whole milk', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', 'Variety of colours Food colouring gel', 'Optional Sprinkle decorations']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 190 C  and line a muffin tin with 6 muffin cases.', 'Using a hand held electric whisk or freestanding mixer mix the butter sugar flour and salt on a low speed until it is the texture of breadcrumbs.', 'Put the eggs in a jug and whisk by hand.', 'Add the milk and vanilla extract and mix together.', 'Pour of the milk mixture into the dry ingredients mix on low speed then mix on a medium speed until smooth thick.', 'Spoon the mixture into the paper cases until full.', 'Bake in the oven for 18 20 minutes or until risen and springy to the touch.', 'Leave to cool slightly and then place on a wire rack.', 'To make the buttercream use a hand held whisk or freestanding mixer slowly whisk the icing sugar with the butter until well mixed add the milk food colouring and vanilla extract then increase the speed to high and whisk until soft and fluffy.', 'Top the cooled cupcakes with the buttercream using a palette knife.', 'Alternatively fill a piping bag with a nozzle inside and pipe swirls of buttercream onto the top of the cupcakes.', 'Sprinkle each cupcake with your chosen decorations.']

column3: [{'main': ['200g Butter ', '200g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar', '3 Egg ', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', '200g Self raising white flour', '0.5 tsp Baking powder', '50g Dark chocolate chips', '50g Fudge pieces']}, {'topping': ['250g Fondant icing sugar', ' Sprinkle decorations']}]
column4: ['Pre heat the oven to 180 C .', 'Beat together the butter caster sugar eggs and vanilla extract until smooth.', 'Sieve the flour and baking powder into the mixture and combine.', 'Fold in the chocolate chips and fudge chunks.', 'Spoon the mixture into 12 cakes cases and bake for 12 15 minutes until golden Leave to cool on a wire rack before decorating with fondant icing and sprinkle decorations.']

column3: [{'main': ['150ml Dairy free milk ', '2 tsp Lemon juice', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', '75g Dairy free butter ', '100g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '125g Allinson s plain white flour', '2 tsp Baking powder', '4 tbsp Unsweeted cocoa powder']}, {'frosting': ['75g Dairy free butter', '225g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', '1 tbsp Dairy free milk ', '30g Cocoa powder']}]
column4: ['Preheat oven to 180 C / 350 F/Gas mark 4.', 'Line a cupcake tray with paper liners.', 'Begin with your wet ingredients.', 'Mix the lemon juice with your chosen milk and set it aside to sour.', 'In a large bowl whisk the melted butter and caster sugar until well combined.', 'Then stir in the milk mixture and the vanilla extract.', 'Sift in the flour baking powder and cocoa.', 'Stir well to combine.', 'Spoon the mixture into the cupcake cases in the cupcake tin.', 'Bake for 15 20 minutes until risen.', 'Use a cocktail stick to see if they re baked by inserting it into the middle and when it comes out clean it s ready.', 'Allow to cool in the tray for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool.', 'While the cakes are cooling begin making your frosting.Mix the vegan butter icing sugar vanilla cocoa powder and and 1 tablespoon of vegan milk until thick and smooth.', 'Spoon the icing into a piping bag and decorate the cupcakes before serving.']

column3: [{'main': ['150g Unsalted butter ', '150g Billington s Unrefined Light Muscovado Sugar', '150g Self raising white flour', '1 tsp Ground ginger', '1/2 tsp Ground cinnamon', '1 pinch Nutmeg ', '3 Free range large egg ', '1 tbsp Milk ']}, {'frosting': ['200g Unsalted butter ', '50g Billington s Unrefined Light Muscovado Sugar', '3 tbsp Milk ', '200g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '1 pinch Ground cinnamon']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C .', 'Place 12 paper cupcake cases into a muffin tin.', 'Cream together the butter and sugar.', 'Sift the flour together with the spices.', 'Gradually mix the eggs into the creamed butter and sugar alternating with the flour.', 'Finally stir through the milk.', 'Dollop the mixture in the cupcake cases and bake for 15 20 minutes until golden.', 'Remove from the oven and leave to cool.', 'For the buttercream melt 50g of the butter in a pan with the muscovado sugar.', 'Add 2 tablespoons of the milk and stir to form a thick toffee sauce.', 'Beat the remaining butter until smooth.', 'Then sift in the icing sugar and add the toffee sauce  stirring thoroughly.', 'Finally pipe the buttercream on to the cupcakes drizzle with the remaining toffee sauce and sprinkle with ground cinnamon.']

column3: [{'main': ['150g Butter ', '150g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '3 Eggs ', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', '150g Self raising white flour', '50g Sprinkle decorations']}, {'frosting': ['80g Unsalted butter ', '250g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '1 tbsp Milk ', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', '50g Sprinkle decorations']}]
column4: ['Preheat your oven to 180 C  and line a cupcake tray with your cupcake cases.', 'Beat together the butter and caster sugar until light and fluffy  Add the eggs one at a time with a spoonful of the flour to prevent the mixture from curdling.', 'Add the vanilla extract and the remaining flour then continue to mix until all of the ingredients are fully combined.', 'Spoon the cake batter into each of the cupcake cases.', 'Only fill the cases 2/3 full this will help you achieve an even bake.', 'Bake the cupcakes for 20 25 or until they are golden in colour and firm to touch.', 'Allow the cupcakes to cool on a wire cooling rack whilst you prepare the buttercream.', 'In a mixing bowl beat together the icing sugar softened butter and vanilla extract until the texture of your buttercream is light and fluffy.', 'You may require a splash of milk to help loosen the mixture.', 'Once the cupcakes are fully cooled use a sharp knife to cut a small circle of sponge from the centre of the cupcake.', 'Remove the sponge and fill the centre of each cupcake with enough sprinkles until it reaches the top.', 'Fill a piping bag with a nozzle and the vanilla buttercream and pipe an even amount on the top of each cupcake covering the hole filled with sprinkles.', 'Finish by topping with a small amount of sprinkles on the buttercream and inserting cupcake toppers .']

column3: [{'main': ['175g Unsalted butter', '175g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '2 large Eggs', '175g Self Raising Flour', '2 tbsp Prosecco']}, {'filling': ['12 whole Strawberries', '150ml Prosecco', '375g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '150g Unsalted butter', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Bean Paste', '2 tbsp Milk']}]
column4: ['Preheat your oven to 180 c/160 c fan and line a 12 hole muffin tin with lining cases Cream together the butter and caster sugar until light and fluffy.', 'Add the eggs oneat a time with a tablespoon of flour each time and beat well until combined.', 'Foldin the remaining flour and then gently mix in the prosecco to make a mixturewith a smooth dropping consistency.', 'Fill each cake case about 2/3 full.', 'If you want to be really precise each case willhave about 50g in it.', 'Bake in your preheated oven for about 25 minutes until well risen and springy.', 'As soon as the cakes are out of the oven remove the cakes from the tin and leavethem to cool on a rack in their cases.', 'While the cakes are cooling soak your strawberries in the Prosecco.', 'Make theicing by whisking the butter icing sugar vanilla bean paste and milk until theyare smooth and combined.', 'If you can use a stand mixer for this and whisk for 5whole minutes.', 'The longer you whisk the softer and lighter the icing willbecome.', 'When the cakes are cool cut a strawberry sized hole in the top and push in awhole soaked strawberry.', 'Do this for all 12 cakes.', 'Finally pipe or spread yourbuttercream onto each cake.', 'Serve soon as the strawberries will make the cake damp inside.']

column3: [{'main': ['180g Dates ', '150ml Water ', '80g Butter ', '150g Billington s Unrefined Light Muscovado Sugar', '2 Egg ', '180g Allinson s Plain White Flour', '1 tsp Bicarbonate of soda', '0.5 tsp Salt', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract']}, {'frosting': ['160g Butter ', '200g Unrefined golden icing sugar', '2 tbsp Toffee sauce', '25g Fudge pieces']}]
column4: ['Place the dates in a bowl and cover with boiling water.', 'Leave to soak for about 30 minutes or while you carry on making the rest of the cake mixture.', 'Preheat the oven to 180 c .', 'Line a 12 hole muffin tray with baking cases.', 'Beat the butter and sugar in a large bowl until light and fluffy and paler in colour.', 'Add the eggs one at a time adding a little flour if the mixture looks a little curdled.', 'Fold in the rest of the flour bicarbonate of soda salt and vanilla extract with a large metal spoon.', 'Finally fold in the dates mixture.', 'Fill the cake cases to three quarters and bake for 20 25 minutes or until risen and golden brown in colour.', 'They may look darker than normal cupcakes that is due to the muscovado sugar giving them a delicious caramel flavour.', 'Leave to cool on a wire rack while making the icing topping.', 'For the icing beat the butter and quarter of the icing sugar in a large bowl until soft.', 'Add the remaining icing a little at a time and beat until smooth.', 'Do not add too much icing sugar at a time or your kitchen will be covered with a fine layer of icing sugar.', 'Swirl in the toffee sauce.', 'Cover the cooled cakes with the icing and sprinkle with the chopped fudge squares.']

column3: [{'main': ['175g Butter ', '175g Billington s Unrefined Light Muscovado Sugar', '3 Egg ', '175g Self raising white flour', '6 tbsp Soda water', '100g Fudge pieces']}, {'sauce': ['50g Billington s Unrefined Light Muscovado Sugar', '50g Butter ']}, {'frosting': ['150g Butter ', '300g Icing sugar', ' Toffee popcorn )']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C .', 'Line a muffin tray with 12 paper cases.', 'Cream the butter and sugar together until creamy.', 'Add the eggs one at a time and mix well then fold in the flour gently.', 'Add the fudge chunks and soda water and mix again.', 'Spoon the mixture into each cake case so they are about two thirds full and bake for 20 minutes.', 'To make the toffee sauce put the sugar and butter in a pan and heat until the sugar has dissolved.', 'The sauce will turn a lovely caramel colour.', 'For the frosting beat the butter gradually add the icing sugar and mixing until quite stiff.', 'Add half the toffee sauce mixture to the buttercream and mix in.', 'When the cakes have cooled spread some toffee buttercream on top.', 'Stick pieces of popcorn into the buttercream on each cupcake.', 'Finally drizzle the rest of the toffee sauce on top.']

column1: Rainbow Swirl Cupcakes by Juliet Sear
column3: [{'main': ['300g Butter ', '300g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '300g Self Raising Flour', '2 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Bean Paste', '6 Eggs ', '1 tsp Baking powder']}, {'frosting': ['250g Butter ', '2 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Bean Paste', '500g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '6 different colours Food colouring gels']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C .', 'Grease 2 x 20 cm  round cake tins or a 12 hole cupcake tray.', 'Place the butter sugar and vanilla or other flavourings into a mixing bowl and combine.', 'If using an electric mixer turn the speed to high  and beat until the mixture is very pale soft and fluffy and the granules of sugar have disappeared.', 'Add the beaten eggs about one quarter at a time beating them in slowly each time.', 'Add the flour gradually one quarter at a time mixing gently on a slow speed until it has mostly been incorporated.', 'Then add the baking powder.', 'Fold with a metal spoon if doing this by hand.', 'Take care not to mix or beat vigorously or your sponge can turn out a bit tough.', 'Scrape the mixture into cupcake cases or lined tins as required.', 'For cupcakes bake for around 12 15 minutes checking every few minutes.', 'For a larger cake begin checking after 20 minutes.', 'Remember all ovens vary so if in doubt use an oven thermometer.', 'The cakes should be a light golden brown springy to the touch.', 'A sharp knife or metal skewer should come out clean and free of mixture when inserted into the centre.', 'Leave to cool for a couple of minutes in the tins then turn out onto a cooling rack.', 'If you have an electric stand mixer then use this with the beater or paddle attachment.', 'Otherwise use a hand held mixer or a wooden spoon.', 'Scrape the seeds from the vanilla pod if using or add the paste.', 'In the mixer or bowl cream the butter with the vanilla seeds and extract until very pale creamy and smooth.', 'Add about one quarter of the icing sugar.', 'To make sure the sugar doesn t puff out in clouds and cover your kitchen mix slowly at first.', 'You can also place a damp tea towel over the bowl.', 'Once the icing sugar is incorporated beat at a high speed for about 1 minute until the mix is really creamy and pale.', 'It will take you a few more minutes by hand.', 'Continue adding the sugar one quarter at a time taking care to beat it in well after each addition.', 'Beat the buttercream at high speed for 1 2 minutes until fluffy and pale.', 'Turn the piping bag inside out then drizzle with strips of the gel colours to create stripes.', 'Turn the bag right side out then fit it with the star nozzle and fill with buttercream.', 'Clip the bag to keep it all in.', 'Squeeze the buttercream onto the cupcakes.', 'Hold the bag in a vertical position and pipe in a spiral starting around the outside edge of the case winding inwards and building height to create a peak.', 'The colour will be blended onto the buttercream giving a lovely rainbow swirl effect.']

column3: [{'main': ['175g Unsalted butter', '175g Allinson s Self Raising Flour', '175g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '1 tsp Baking powder', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', '3 Large free range eggs']}, {'frosting': ['175g Unsalted butter ', '350g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '1 tbsp Milk', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', 'A drop Pink food colouring']}, {'bunny_ears': ['250g White sugarpaste icing', '250g Pink sugarpaste icing']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C/gas mark 4 and line the 12 hole muffin tin with paper cupcake or muffin cases.', 'Put all the cake ingredients into a bowl and beat until smooth and evenly mixed.', 'Divide the mixture evenly between the paper cases and bake for 20 25 minutes.', 'Meanwhile make the bunny ears.', 'Roll out the white sugarpaste icing and the pink sugarpaste icing to approximately 2 3mm thick .With a sharp knife cut out the bunny ear shape making sure the the white sugarpaste ears are 2mm bigger than the pink.', 'With a little bit of edible glue  stick the pink inner ear to the outer white ear.', 'You can bend the ears over slightly if you want to give different looks.', 'The sugarpaste will start to harden quite quickly so it s best to work as quickly as you can so it doesn t start to crack.', 'Leave the cupcakes to cool on a wire rack while you make some buttercream.', 'In a large bowl put the butter vanilla extract 1 tbsp of milk and half the icing sugar and beat until smooth.', 'Add in the remaining icing sugar and mix well until combined.', 'Add more milk if you need to loosen it.', 'Add the food colouring a tiny bit at a time until you get the desired colour.', 'Once the cupcakes have cooled completely pipe your buttercream in any design you like.', 'Add 2 of the bunny ears in to the pink buttercream icing in each cupcake.']

column3: [{'main': ['3 Egg ', '150g Butter ', '150g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '175g Self raising white flour', '25g Cocoa powder']}, {'frosting': ['300g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '100g Butter ', '40g Cocoa powder', '40ml Milk ']}, {'filling': ['100g Mini marshmallows', '12 Marshmallows ']}]
column4: ['Preheat your oven to 180 C  and line a cupcake tin with 12 cupcake cases.', 'Cream together the butter and sugar using a freestanding or hand held electric mixer until pale and fluffy.', 'Add the eggs one by one beating in between.', 'Carefully fold in the flour and cocoa powder until smooth and well mixed.', 'Spoon into the cases until 2/3 full then place in the oven for about 20 minutes until a skewer inserted into the cake comes out clean.', 'Remove from the oven and leave to cool slightly before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.', 'To make the buttercream beat together the icing sugar butter and cocoa powder until well mixed then slowly add the milk whilst still beating.', 'Continue beating until light and fluffy.', 'Next gently melt the large marshmallows in a heatproof bowl over simmering water.', 'Scoop out a small well in the centre of each cupcake and pour in a little melted marshmallow into each one then leave to cool.', 'Finally use a spoon or small palette knife to spread chocolate frosting onto the cakes and finish with the small marshmallows.']

column3: [{'main': ['200g Unsalted butter ', '100g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '100g Billington s Unrefined Light Muscovado Sugar', '1 tsp Nielsen massey chocolate extract', '4 Medium free range eggs ', '150g Self raising white flour', '50g Cocoa powder', '2 tbsp Whole milk']}, {'syrup': ['50g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '4 tbsp Water', '1 tsp Peppermint extract']}, {'frosting': ['200g Cream cheese', '100g Unsalted butter ', '600g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '1 tsp Nielsen massey peppermint extract']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C .', 'Line two 12 whole cupcake tins with cupcake cases.', 'Using either an electric mixer or mixing bowl and whisk beat the butter and sugars together until pale and fluffy then whisk in the chocolate extract.', 'Reduce the whisk speed and slowly add the eggs along with a tbsp of the flour to prevent it from curdling.', 'To make the syrup place the golden caster sugar in a pan with the water.', 'Simmer for a few minutes until dissolved then take off the heat and set aside to cool.', 'Once cool stir in 1tsp of peppermint extract.', 'Add the remaining flour cocoa and milk to the butter and sugar mixture.', 'Using either a piping bag or ice cream scoop divide the batter between the cupcake cases and place in the oven for 20 minutes or until lightly golden and firm to the touch.', 'Leave the cakes to cool a little on a wire rack then add some sugar syrup to the top of each one.', 'Once completely cooled remove from the tins.', 'To ice put the cream cheese butter peppermint extract and golden icing sugar in a mixing bowl and slowly mix together until light and fluffy.', 'Place in a piping bag and ice accordingly.']

column3: [{'main': ['115g Unsalted butter ', '115g Silver Spoon Caster Sugar', '2 Eggs', '115g Allinson s Self Raising White Flour', '1 tsp Cocoa powder', '0.5 tsp Baking powder']}, {'frosting': ['85g Unsalted butter ', '2 tbsp Whole milk', '1 tbsp Cocoa powder', '225g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', 'Handful Mini chocolate eggs ']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven 190 C .', 'Line a muffin tin with 12 14 cases.', 'Mix together the cocoa powder flour and baking powder and sift.', 'Place all the ingredients together in a mixing bowl and beat together with a wooden spoon until well mixed.', 'Spoon the mixture into the muffin tin.', 'Bake the cupcakes on the middle shelf of your oven for 15 20 minutes until the cupcakes are cooked throughout and spring to touch.', 'Cool on a wire tray.', 'For the chocolate buttercream place all ingredients in a mixing bowl and beat until smooth.', 'Either spread or pipe over the cakes creating a nest effect and decorate with Easter eggs.']

column3: [{'main': ['250g Unsalted butter ', '250g Silver Spoon Caster Sugar', '4 Free range medium eggs', '250g Allinson s Self Raising White Flour', '2 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract']}, {'frosting': ['150g Unsalted butter', '300g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '1 tbsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Bean Paste']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C  and line a tin with 12 cupcake cases.', 'In a large bowl cream together the butter and sugar until pale and fluffy.', 'Add the eggs one at a time mixing well between each addition then add the vanilla extract.', 'Carefully fold in the flour then spoon into the cupcakes cases until they are about 2/3 full.', 'Bake in the oven for 25 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean.', 'Leave to cool completely on a cooling wire.', 'To make the buttercream beat together the butter and icing sugar until light and fluffy then add the vanilla bean paste and mix until well distributed.', 'Fill a piping bag with the buttercream and pipe onto the cakes.']

column3: [{'main': ['150g Unsalted softened butter', '150g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '3 Eggs', '150g Allinson s Self Raising White Flour', '0.5 tsp Baking powder', '1 Lemon zest', '1 tsp Lemon juice']}, {'topping': ['175g Silver spoon fondant icing sugar', '1 drop Green food colouring gel', '175g White sugar paste icing', 'A few Chocolate buttons', '1 Jelly beans ', 'A few Sprinkle decorations ', 'A few Strawberry laces', 'A drop Red food colouring gel']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C .', 'Place paper cases in a 12 hole muffin tin.', 'If you want to weigh it out that s 50g per case.', 'Beat the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl until light and fluffy.', 'Beat in the eggs a little at a time until smooth.', 'Sift in the flour and baking powder lemon zest and juice and gently fold in until incorporated.', 'Spoon into the paper cases and bake for 17 20 minutes until golden and springy to the touch.', 'Remove from the tin and cool on a wire rack.', 'For the icing sift the fondant icing sugar into a bowl and mix with the hot water as directed on the packet until smooth.', 'Add a few drops of green food colouring and spread over the top of the cakes.', 'Stick an orange jelly bean in the centre of each cake for the nose.', 'Colour 3/4 of sugar paste icing with green food colouring  roll into balls and stick on top of the frosting for the eyes.', 'Attach chocolate buttons to the sugar paste icing balls with a small dab of frosting.', 'Dilute a little green food colouring with water and paint onto the lower half of the sugar paste icing balls using a fine brush.', 'Attach 2 strawberry lace bits above the eyes for the feelers.', 'Sprinkle orange sprinkles on top of some of the cakes and attach strawberry laces to form legs.', 'Knead a small amount of red food colouring into the remaining sugar paste icing and cut into mouth shapes.', 'Place on the cakes.']

column3: [{'curd': ['175g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar', ' Lemon juice ', '2 Egg ', '110g Butter ']}, {'main': ['100g Butter ', '100g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar', '1 Vanilla pods ', '2 Egg ', '100g Self raising white flour', '1 Lemon zest', '3 tbsp Candied lemon zest )', '75g Lemon curd ']}, {'italian_meringue': ['2 Egg white ', '50ml Water', '100 Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar', '1 Lemon ', ' Icing sugar ']}]
column4: ['For the lemon curd place the sugar and lemon juice in a heatproof bowl then add the eggs and butter.', 'Don t allow the mixture to sit around start whisking immediately as the sugar and acidity of lemons will start to cook the eggs.', 'Place the bowl over a pan of gently simmering water but be careful that the bowl doesn t touch the water.', 'Cook over gentle heat whisking all the time until butter melted and mixture has thickened.', 'The mixture will continue to thicken on cooling.', 'Place the curd in sterilised jar and put to one side while prepare the sponge.', 'For the cupcake sponge preheat the oven to 180 C and line a cupcake tray with paper cases.', 'Cream the butter sugar and vanilla seeds together in a large mixing bowl until pale fluffy and well combined.', 'Crack in the eggs one at a time and beat until both are fully incorporated into the mixture.', 'Fold in the flour candied lemon zest if using and lemon zest until well combined.', 'Place a couple teaspoons of batter in the bottom of the cases and add a teaspoonful of lemon curd to the middle of each cupcake and then cover with a little more mixture.', 'Bake the cupcakes in the oven for 15 20 minutes or until they are pale golden brown and spring back when pressed lightly in the centre.', 'For the meringue make a sugar syrup by dissolving sugar in water over a gentle heat.', 'Whisk the egg whites until soft peaks and doubled in volume.', 'Gradually add the sugar syrup while you continue to whisk being careful that the syrup doesn t touch the whisks/beaters.', 'Keep whisking continuously until the meringue mixture is thick and glossy and has cooled down check by feeling the side of the mixing bowl.', 'Spoon the meringue in a piping bag and pipe some meringue on the top of each cake using a blow torch lightly brown the top of each cake to toast the meringue.', 'Finish with lemon zest and sprinkling icing sugar.']

column3: [{'main': ['3 Earl grey tea bags', '120ml Milk ', '140g Caster sugar ', '120g Allinson s Plain White Flour', '1.5 tsp Baking powder', '1pinch Salt', '40g Butter ', '1 Egg ']}, {'frosting': ['50ml Milk ', '500g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '160g Butter ', ' Food colouring ']}]
column4: ['Place the tea bags milk in a saucepan and gently heat to brew the tea leave to cool overnight if possible.', 'Preheat the oven to 190 C  and line a 12 bun muffin tin with muffin cases.', 'Using a hand held mixer or freestanding mixer mix the butter sugar flour baking powder and salt on a low speed until it is the texture of breadcrumbs.', 'Put the eggs in a jug and whisk by hand.', 'Add the tea infused milk to the eggs try to squeeze all the milk from the tea bags set them aside for the frosting.', 'Pour the milk mixture into the dry ingredients mix on low speed then mix on a medium speed until smooth thick.', 'Spoon the mixture into the paper cases until full.', 'Bake in the oven for 18 20 minutes or until risen and springy to the touch.', 'Leave to cool slightly and then place on a wire rack.', 'While the cupcakes are cooking place the used tea bags in a small bowl with the milk for the frosting leave to infuse for 30 minutes.', 'Remove the tea bags and carefully try to squeeze as much milk out as possible.', 'Using the electric whisk or a freestanding mixer whisk the icing sugar with the butter until combined then pour in the tea infused milk mixing slowly gradually increasing the speed to high and whisk until soft fluffy.', 'Add food colouring to your desired colour.', 'Top the cooled cupcakes with frosting with a palette knife.', 'Sprinkle each cupcake with some sprinkles or edible glitter.']

column1: Earl Grey cupcakes with lemon buttercream
column3: [{'main': ['3 Earl grey tea bags', '4 tbsp Water ', '225g Butter ', '225g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster sugar', '4 Eggs ', '225g Self raising white flour', '1 tsp Baking powder', '1 tsp Bicarbonate of soda']}, {'frosting': ['150g Butter ', '275g Icing sugar', '1 Lemon ']}]
column4: ['Preheat your oven to 200 C  and line two muffin tins with paper cases.', 'Soak the tea bags in the boiled water.', 'When you think the tea is strong enough squeeze the liquid out of the tea bags and discard the bags.', 'Beat all of the cupcake ingredients including the Earl Grey tea in a large mixing bowl for at least three minutes until the mixture is combined and has a thick dropping texture.', 'Divide the mixture evenly into the muffin cases then bake for fifteen to eighteen minutes.', 'Allow them to cool in tins before placing on a cooling rack.', 'To make the icing beat the butter and gradually add the icing sugar.Remove the peel from the lemon using a potato peeler and keep.Add the juice from half the lemon to the icing and beat until soft.', 'Pipe onto the cup cakes.', 'Remove all the pith from the lemon peel and slice into thin strips.', 'Tie into a loose knot and place onto the iced cakes.', 'Serve.']

column3: [{'main': ['200g Unsalted butter ', '200g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '1 tsp Nielsen massey rose water', '4 Medium free range eggs ', '200g Self raising white flour']}, {'rose_water': ['50g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '4 tbsp Water', '1 tsp Nielsen massey rose water']}, {'frosting': ['200g Cream cheese', '100g Unsalted butter ', '600g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '1 tsp Nielsen massey rose water', '2 drops Pink food colouring gel']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C .', 'Using either an electric mixer or mixing bowl and whisk beat the butter and golden caster sugar together until pale and fluffy.', 'Gradually add the eggs to the mixture with a spoonful of flour after each egg to prevent the mix from curdling.', 'To make the syrup place the golden caster sugar in a pan with the water.', 'Simmer for a few minutes until dissolved then take off the heat and set aside to cool.', 'Once cool stir in 1 tsp of rose water.', 'Add the remaining flour to the butter and sugar mixture.', 'Using either a piping bag or ice cream scoop divide the batter between the cupcake cases and place in the oven for 20 minutes or until lightly golden and firm to the touch.', 'Leave the cakes to cool a little on a wire rack then add some sugar syrup to the top of each one.', 'Once completely cooled remove from the tins.', 'To ice put the cream cheese butter rose water and golden icing sugar in a mixing bowl and slowly mix together until light and fluffy.', 'If using add a few drops of pink colouring until you reach the desired shade.', 'Place in a piping bag and ice accordingly.']

column3: [{'main': ['150g Butter ', '150g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '3 Egg ', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', '2 tbsp Milk', '150g Self raising white flour']}, {'topping': ['85g Butter ', '175g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', '1 tbsp Milk ', ' Red sugar paste icing', ' White sugar paste icing', ' Black sugar paste icing', ' Writing icing']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 170 C .', 'Line a cup cake tin with cup cake cases.', 'Make sure your butter is nice and soft to start with so it is easy to beat.', 'Add the caster sugar to the butter and using a wooden spoon  beat the butter and sugar until it is really smooth and creamy.', 'Beat the eggs together lightly with a fork then add a drop at a time to the butter and sugar mixture beating really well until the mixture is emulsified before adding the next bit of egg.', 'If the mixture starts to curdle just beat in a tablespoon of the flour and continue.', 'Using a large metal spoon fold in the vanilla extract milk and flour lifting the mixture in a figure of eight to scoop up the flour and fold it in.', 'Do this as lightly as you can to keep all the air in your mixture.', 'Using a dessert spoon place a rounded spoonful in each cake case.', 'Bake for about 15 18 minutes but check after 15 minutes.', 'The cakes should be evenly browned and just feel firm and springy when you touch them in the centre.', 'Allow to cool for 5 minutes then remove from the tin and allow to cool completely.', 'To make the buttercream beat together the butter icing sugar milk and vanilla extract until it becomes a smooth texture.', 'Either pipe or smooth on to the top of the cupcake.', 'To decorate roll out the red sugar paste icing and using a circular cutter press out 12 circles  Then roll out 12 small circular balls for the noses.', 'Secure these on to the centre of the circle using a light brushing of water.', 'To make the eyes roll out white sugar paste icing in to small balls and flatten gently between your thumb and finger.', 'Secure these above the nose and make the black dots either using a edible decorating pen or writing icing.', 'Finally for the smile roll a small sausage shape of black sugar paste icing for each face and secure onto the red circle with water curving slightly to make the expression.', 'Place the red sugar paste circle carefully on top of the buttercream on your cupcake.', 'This will set in place once the buttercream hardens.']

column3: [{'main': ['100g Butter ', '100g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '2 Egg ', '75g Self raising white flour', '25g Cocoa powder', '0.25 tsp Baking powder', '9 Ice cream cup cones']}, {'frosting': ['50g Butter ', '150g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '2 tbsp Cocoa powder']}, {'topping': ['250g Sugar paste icing ', '250g Sugar paste icing ', ' Icing sugar ']}]
column4: ['Heat the oven to 180 C .', 'Place the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl and beat with a wooden spoon or electric mixer until light and fluffy.', 'Gradually beat in the eggs a little at a time until smooth adding a little flour if the mixture curdles.', 'Stir in the flour baking powder and cocoa until smooth.', 'Place a dessertspoon full in each ice cream cup and place them inside a cupcake tin to keep them standing upright bake for 15 18 minutes until golden brown and just firm to the touch.', 'Allow to cool completely.', 'To make the buttercream place the butter in a bowl with 1 2 tsp boiling water add the icing sugar and cocoa and beat until smooth.', 'Spread each cake with a little of the icing.', 'To decorate roll small balls of green icing into oval shapes flatted slightly into leaf shapes then score with the back of a knife to make veins.', 'Roll the pink sugar paste icing thinly on a work surface dusted with icing sugar and use flower cutters to cut out blossoms.', 'Add little balls of complimentary coloured icing for the centre of the flowers and arrange on top of the leaves.']

column3: [{'main': ['200g Unsalted butter ', '200g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Lemon Extract', '1 Lemon ', '4 Medium free range eggs ', '200g Self raising white flour']}, {'syrup': ['50g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '4 tbsp Lemon juice', '1 tsp Nielsen Massey Lemon Extract', '1 Lemon zest']}, {'frosting': ['200g Cream cheese', '100g Butter ', '600g Unrefined golden icing sugar', '1 tsp Lemon extract']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C .', 'Line two cupcake trays with cupcake cases.', 'Using either an electric mixer or mixing bowl and whisk beat the butter and golden caster sugar together until pale and fluffy then whisk in the lemon extract and lemon zest.', 'Reduce the whisk speed and slowly add the eggs along with a tbsp of the flour to prevent it from curdling.', 'Add the remaining flour to the butter and sugar mixture.', 'Using either a piping bag or ice cream scoop divide the batter between the cupcake cases and place in the oven for 20 minutes or until lightly golden and firm to the touch.', 'Leave the cakes to cool a little on a wire rack.', 'To make the syrup place the golden caster sugar in a pan with the lemon juice.', 'Simmer for a few minutes until dissolved then take off the heat and set aside to cool.', 'Once cool stir in 1tsp of lemon extract and zest.', 'Add some sugar syrup to the top of each cupcake.', 'To ice put the cream cheese butter lemon extract and golden icing sugar in a mixing bowl and slowly mix together until light and fluffy.', 'Place in a piping bag and ice accordingly.', 'Top with lemon sweets.']

column3: [{'main': ['50g Cocoa powder', '175g Self raising flour', '1 tsp Baking powder', '225g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '225g Anchor unsalted butter', '3 Free range large eggs', '1 tsp Nielsen massey chocolate extract']}, {'frosting': ['500g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '160g Anchor unsalted butter', '50ml Milk ', 'Few Drops of green food colouring', '1 Pot of christmas sprinkles']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C  and line a muffin tin with muffin cases.', 'Cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.', 'Add the eggs one by one mixing well in between then add the chocolate extract.', 'Finally fold in the flour cocoa and baking powder until well combined.', 'Spoon the mixture evenly into the cases and bake in the oven for 25 minutes or until they are springy to the touch and a skewer comes out clean.', 'To make the buttercream use an electric mixer or hand mixer to mix the icing sugar and butter together until you get a breadcrumb texture then add the milk and mix on high speed until and fluffy.', 'Add a few drops of green food colouring to the buttercream and mix until you get a Christmas tree green colour.', 'Pipe the buttercream onto the cakes in a pyramid and top the trees with festive sprinkles for the perfect finishing touch.']

column3: [{'main': ['2 Egg ', '125g Butter ', '125g Billington s Unrefined Light Muscovado Sugar', '175g Self raising white flour', '0.5 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', '2 tbsp Maple syrup flavour ', '0.5 tsp Cinnamon ']}, {'frosting': ['2 tbsp Maple syrup flavour', '250g Butter ', '500g Icing sugar']}, {'maple_pecans': ['2 tbsp Maple syrup', '12 Pecan nuts ']}]
column4: ['Preheat the oven to 180 C  and line a cupcake tin with 12 cupcake cases.', 'Place the eggs butter sugar flour vanilla and maple syrup in the bowl of an electric mixer or food processor and mix together until smooth.', 'Divide the batter evenly between the 12 cases then place in the oven and bake for 15 20 minutes until a skewer comes out clean.', 'To make the pecans place the maple syrup and pecan nuts in small saucepan and gently heat stirring until the pan is dry and the pecans are glossy.', 'Pour onto greaseproof paper separate then leave to cool and dry.', 'Next make the icing beat together the butter and icing sugar then add the maple syrup and beat again until light and fluffy.', 'Fill a piping bag and pipe swirls onto the cooled cakes.', 'Decorate with a maple coated pecan nut.', 'Store in an airtight container and eat within 3 4 days']

column3: [{'main': ['200g Unsalted butter ', '200g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '1 1/2 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract', '4 Medium free range eggs ', '200g Self raising white flour']}, {'syrup': ['50g Billington s Unrefined Golden Caster Sugar', '4 tbsp Water', '1 1/2 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract']}, {'frosting': ['200g Cream cheese', '100g Unsalted butter ', '600g Silver Spoon Icing Sugar', '1 1/2 tsp Nielsen Massey Vanilla Extract']}]
